summary: The Right to Treat Act (S. 1830) aims to limit the authority of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and its agencies, including the FDA, NIH, and CDC, to regulate the practice of medicine. It seeks to prevent federal restrictions on prescribing or using FDA-approved drugs for unapproved uses, with exceptions for abortion, assisted suicide, and other specific medical procedures. This bill seeks to define the boundaries of federal oversight in medical practice.
